DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the kitchen thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode with medium fan speed?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The thermostat accepts a target temperature between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, modes include Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto, and fan speeds are Low, Medium, and High. 

To fulfill the request:
1. Use the Set Target Temperature command with parameter 22.0 °C.
2. Use the Set Mode command with parameter Heat (enum value 1).
3. Use the Set Fan Speed command with parameter Medium (enum value 1).

Result: Execute STT(22.0), SM(1), and SFS(1) to set the thermostat to 22 °C, heat mode, and medium fan speed respectively.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [DOF]
    Set Brightness [SB]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]
    Report Brightness [RB]
    Report Color Temperature [RCT]

USER QUERY:
I want to dim the living room light to 40% brightness and set the color temperature to 3000 Kelvin. How do I do that?

The device properties show brightness and color temperature ranges: brightness from 0 to 100%, and color temperature from 2700 to 6500 K. The accepted commands to adjust these are Set Brightness and Set Color Temperature.

To dim the light to 40%, send the Set Brightness command with parameter 40. To set the color temperature to 3000 K, send the Set Color Temperature command with parameter 3000.

Result: Execute SB(40) and SCT(3000) to dim the light to 40% brightness and set the color temperature to 3000 K.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [ULD]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently locked and closed? If not, please lock and close it.

First, I check the device properties: Door Status can be Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing; Lock Status can be Locked or Unlocked.

To answer if the door is locked and closed, I would query the current Door Status and Lock Status.

If the door is not Closed, I will send the Close Door command. If the door is not Locked, I will send the Lock Door command.

Result: Query the statuses first. If needed, execute CD to close the door and LD to lock it, ensuring the garage door is both closed and locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bathroom Exhaust Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 1 to 5 Unit level
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit level
    Set Timer [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Status [RPS]
    Report Speed Level [RSL]
    Report Timer [RT]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the bathroom fan at speed level 3 and set a timer for 30 minutes.

The device properties indicate the fan can be On or Off, speed levels range from 1 to 5, and the timer can be set from 0 to 120 minutes.

To fulfill the request:
1. Use Turn On command to power the fan on.
2. Use Set Speed command with parameter 3 to set speed level.
3. Use Set Timer command with parameter 30 to set the timer.

Result: Execute TON, SS(3), and ST(30) to turn on the fan at speed 3 with a 30-minute timer.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit liters_per_minute
    Schedule
      Enum
        Morning [0]
        Afternoon [1]
        Evening [2]
        Off [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [SW]
    Stop Watering [SPW]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit liters_per_minute
    Set Schedule [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Morning [0]
          Afternoon [1]
          Evening [2]
          Off [3]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Schedule [RSC]

USER QUERY:
Can you schedule the sprinkler to water in the evening with a flow rate of 10 liters per minute?

The sprinkler system properties show the schedule can be set to Morning, Afternoon, Evening, or Off, and the flow rate ranges from 0.0 to 15.0 liters per minute.

To schedule watering in the evening, use the Set Schedule command with parameter Evening (enum value 2). To set the flow rate to 10 liters per minute, use the Set Flow Rate command with parameter 10.0.

Result: Execute SS(2) and SFR(10.0) to schedule evening watering with a 10 liters per minute flow rate.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

  ***Properties***

        Medium [1]
        High [2]

      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Air Quality
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Reset Filter [RF]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***

    Report Fan Speed [RFS]
    Report Filter Life [RFL]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the bedroom air purifier and set the fan speed to high. Also, how much filter life is remaining?

The device properties indicate power can be On or Off, fan speed has Low, Medium, and High settings, and filter life is a percentage from 0 to 100%.

To turn on the purifier, use the Power On command. To set fan speed to high, use Set Fan Speed with parameter High (enum value 2). To check filter life, query the Filter Life property.

Result: Execute PON and SFS(2) to turn on the purifier and set fan speed to high. Then, query filter life to determine remaining percentage.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Is there motion detected in the hallway? Also, can you increase the sensitivity to 8?

The device properties show motion detection as a boolean enum and sensitivity level from 1 to 10.

To check if motion is detected, query the Motion Detected property. To increase sensitivity to 8, use the Set Sensitivity command with parameter 8.

Result: Query motion status first. Then execute SS(8) to set sensitivity to level 8.

Can you turn on the dining room chandelier to 75% brightness with a ramp rate of 1.0 minute and enable responding?

The chandelier's properties include Status and On Level from 0 to 100%, Ramp Rate with multiple enum values including 1.0 minute (enum 12), and Responding which can be True or False.

To turn on the chandelier to 75% brightness, use the On command with parameter 75. To set the ramp rate to 1.0 minute, use the Ramp Rate command with enum 12. To enable responding, set Responding to True (enum 0).

Result: Execute DON(75) to turn on at 75%, RR(12) to set ramp rate to 1.0 minute, and set Responding property to True to enable responding.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:

      Range 0.0 to 50000.0 Unit kWh
    Voltage
      Range 100.0 to 240.0 Unit Volts
    Current

  ***Accept Commands***
    Query Power Usage [QPU]
    Query Energy Consumed [QEC]
    Query Voltage [QV]
    Query Current [QC]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [RPU]
    Report Energy Consumed [REC]
    Report Voltage [RV]
    Report Current [RC]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and voltage of the home energy monitor?

The device properties include Current Power Usage in Watts and Voltage in Volts. To get these values, the device accepts Query Power Usage and Query Voltage commands.

To answer the query, send QPU to get current power usage and QV to get voltage.

Result: Execute QPU and QV commands to retrieve current power usage in Watts and voltage in Volts from the energy monitor.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***

  ***Properties***

      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RP]
    Report Tilt [RT]
    Report Battery [RB]

USER QUERY:
Please open the window shade halfway and tilt the slats to 30 degrees.

The device properties show Position from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open), and Tilt Angle from -90 to 90 degrees.

To open the shade halfway, set Position to 50%. To tilt the slats to 30 degrees, set Tilt Angle to 30.

Result: Execute SP(50) to open halfway and ST(30) to tilt slats to 30 degrees.
